A: 1. Determiners like few, some, and many are also called _ (a) verbs (b) nouns (c) determiners
2. The word 'much' is a _ (a) verb (b) determiner (c) adjective
3. 'Any' is an example of a _ (a) noun (b) determiner (c) adverb
4. Adjectives are words that describe a _ (a) verb (b) noun (c) adverb
5. Which word is an adjective? (a) slowly (b) beautiful (c) arrived
6. The word 'greedy' is an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) preposition
7. 'Ugly' is a word that describes a _ (a) noun (b) verb (c) time
8. Which word is an adjective? (a) rich (b) pain (c) success
9. Adverbs tell you more about _ (a) nouns (b) adjectives (c) verbs
10. Many adverbs end in _ (a) -ly (b) -ing (c) -ed
11. Adverbs of manner tell you _ actions happen (a) when (b) where (c) how
12. Adverbs of time tell you _ actions happen (a) how (b) when (c) where
13. Adverbs of place tell you _ actions happen (a) where (b) how (c) when
14. In "The old lady walked slowly," 'slowly' is an adverb of _ (a) time (b) manner (c) place
15. In "All the guests arrived late," 'late' is an adverb of _ (a) place (b) manner (c) time
16. 'Everywhere' is an example of an adverb of _ (a) time (b) place (c) manner
17. A preposition tells you _ something is in relation to something else (a) how (b) where or when (c) why
18. Prepositions usually have a _ after them (a) verb (b) adjective (c) noun or pronoun
19. Which word is a preposition? (a) arrived (b) above (c) beautiful
20. 'Under' is an example of a _ (a) determiner (b) preposition (c) adverb
21. Which word is NOT a preposition example? (a) between (b) slowly (c) inside
22. The words 'is' and 'are' are forms of the verb _ (a) do (b) be (c) have
23. You use 'is' with _ nouns (a) plural (b) singular (c) both
24. You use 'isn't' with _ nouns (a) plural (b) singular (c) many
25. You use 'are' with _ nouns (a) singular (b) plural (c) one
26. You use 'aren't' with _ nouns (a) plural (b) singular (c) few
27. The word 'some' is a _ (a) verb (b) determiner (c) noun
28. The word 'rich' is an _ (a) adverb (b) adjective (c) noun
29. The word 'pain' is a _ (a) adjective (b) noun (c) adverb
30. The word 'success' is a _ (a) adjective (b) noun (c) adverb
C: 1. List two types of adverbs mentioned in the text.
2. What is the primary function of a preposition?
3. Name two forms of the verb 'be' used with singular nouns.
4. Identify two examples of determiners from the provided text.
5. What do adjectives tell you about?
answers_C: Adverb of manner, Adverb of time, Adverb of place
It tells where or when something is in relation to something else.
Adjectives describe or talk about a Noun.
